website_summaries.verdict: An all-around excellent keyboard at a great price, this model is less noisy than other mechanical keyboards.
pros: Constructed of aluminum and sporting a gold-plated USB connector, this is a heavy-duty (3.5 pounds), full-size mechanical keyboard
We particularly love the customizable LED modes, as well as the quieter nature of the Brown switches
cons: The keys can be super sensitive, and some buyers have had issues with the key font
We recommend getting a wrist rest to go with this

customer_reviews.title: ... keyboard for a few days now and it feels awesome!: D This is my first mechanical keyboard ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had my keyboard for a few days now and it feels awesome! :D This is my first mechanical keyboard and I was looking for a cherry mx brown so that typing wouldn't be too loud and this is it, great typing experience with good audible keystrokes but not annoying, perfect balance I would say.
customer_reviews.author: carlosjln

customer_reviews.title: it's perfectly fine. The trouble is
customer_reviews.text: When the keyboard works, it's perfectly fine. The trouble is, it often just doesn't work. Plug it in and the lights will come on briefly (5 seconds) then turn off. If you install RedDragon drivers (which should be totally unnecessary for a keyboard in the first place) the keyboard will work for a few days, then revert back to the previous non-working behavior. Googling around it looks like a lot of other people experience similar issues. Can't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Brown

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and no input from key(s)
customer_reviews.text: I had this keyboard delivered on June 6th and it's now June 28th. I've had the issue for a few days now where the Tab key doesn't get input easily. I either have to press it much harder or on the bottom part of it more specifically. A mechanical should not be having input issues after only 3 weeks of use... It's all nice and flashy, but the sole purpose of it is to be good for gaming, which it seems to not be heading towards that direction.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Have now received TWO defective keyboards!
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received the "-" key on the number pad did not work at all from day one. I was able to get it replaced by returning it to Amazon. The second one started having problems with the "a" key after about one month. Sometimes it works and sometimes not. Unfortunately, this problem popped up after the Amazon return period had ended. I wrote RedragonUSA directly TWICE about this problem. So far the response from their support: crickets. For a very expensive keyboard this is quite disappointing both in terms of quality and of support and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Friar Jr.

customer_reviews.title: There are better keyboards for cheaper. Avoid
customer_reviews.text: the reddragon k556 is an all around cheap board and it shows. The keys sound cheap and the board is poor quality. After a couple days of using my new keyboard, it gave out entirely. Tried moving it to different USB ports that were confirmed working to no result. I ordered a replacement and it arrived factory sealed in a shipping box showing no signs of damage. The board already had snapped off keys and the logo on the board was hanging off. The board comes with thousands of lighting options, but it really only needs "lemon" yellow. There are better mechanical keyboards in this price range I would advise you look elsewhere before buying one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Roth

customer_reviews.title: Finally Gave Up on It.
customer_reviews.text: First -- I like most things about the keyboard -- feels solid, seems well made, lots of cool lighting effects. But ultimately it failed at being a reliable keyboard. Keys would randomly stop working for various periods of time. One day the w wouldn't work, the next day the n, etc... The keys would be unresponsive / partially responsive for a few days, and then spontaneously start working again. Very frustrating, and I ultimately got sick of it and bought a new one from a different manufacturer. Edit: Redragon contacted me and offered to send a new keyboard. I did not contact them. That's pretty great customer service if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Redragon and dont look back
customer_reviews.text: Bought 9/20/19. I love open-face keyboards and have purchased and used many of the Redragon keyboards in the past years. Needed a less clicky one for work. no issues ---- 8/23/20. Esc, ~/` , Tab, Caps Lock, Left shift and Left Control. No input is received/not working. Tried different USB ports on the same computer, no change. a 2nd computer, no change. Worked with Redragon shop, tested and they sent a replacement, which I am typing this update on. Awesome service!
customer_reviews.author: Zadias

customer_reviews.title: Three Months Before First Switch Replacements
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was working great until a few days ago (conveniently just a few days after the return period ended). Multiple switches started failing frequently. It turns out at least some of the switches on this keyboard are actually glued down to the frame (in my case it was the A key). This makes the included tools potentially useless depending on the key you need to switch out. That being said once I finally yanked the old switch out and replaced it the key now works again as expected. Still does not inspire confidence in my purchase to be swapping out faulty switches three months post-purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The shift key is almost unusable after just a few weeks, I have to smash it down with the might of Zeus in order for it to work. My previous keyboard was from the same company and that managed to last over a year before a key broke, and then it took yet another year for a different key to break. This keyboard didn't even last 3 months before a switch broke. This company has lost my business.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe S.

customer_reviews.title: Metallic ringing after key press
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to keep this keyboard for a number of reasons. For one, the RGB and light displays are undoubtedly very impressive for the price point. The keys are very responsive and I liked the heavyweight feel of the unit. However, the inescapable drawback for me was the slight metallic "ting" sound that echoed after every key press. It's not very noticeable at first, but once you hear it, you can't unhear it. Maybe if you're gaming with headphones and loud music on, this wouldn't be an issue. but it was enough of a deal-breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can I give this 6 stars?
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard for office use!!! I bought this keyboard to replace the Redragon K582 SURARA keyboard that I just returned because I didn't like the linear switches, and it emitted a very loud gong-like ring with every keystroke. LIKES: Switches- The MX Cherry Brown equivalent switches feel great. Typing Experience- Very satisfying. Noise- Very quiet. (if you don't bottom out or release quickly) Build Quality- Very solid, all metal frame. Very rigid with no deck flex. LED Brightness- Very bright, text on the keycaps is very sharp and crisp. DISLIKES None. SUMMARY: This keyboard is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Generic User

customer_reviews.title: different than others, read description carefully
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this, as I already had the non-number red dragon keyboard that I love. turns out you have to read the fine print. not all red dragon mechanical keyboards are the same. this one does not have that 'click/clack" feel that my other one does. instead, it feels like any other logictec basic keyboard (that costs half as much). will give to one of the kids, but disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K. Putnam

customer_reviews.title: Not supported by Redragon
customer_reviews.text: This product is not supported by Redragon because Redgragon didn't sell the item. CElectus sells it and the software I found was quarantined by WIN 10 PRO for some reason. The keyboard is the loudest I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of flash but apparently not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful keyboard, but after less than one year of use the "o" key just stopped working. Fortunately they provided replacement key switches and a tool, after changing it out it works again. Still, less than a year of not too hard use shouldn't be all it can take.
customer_reviews.author: M. Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I initially had purchased the Redragon cherry blue keyboard which had no numeric keys. I really loved that keyboard including it's tactile feel, although it is very clearly audible. I realized that I use the number keys more than I thought, so I purchased this keyboard as it has the numeric keypad, but more importantly, it is cherry brown which has the same tactile input and feel as cherry blue without the auditory response. Overall, I highly recommend as I write this review from the very same keyboard. These keyboards have 50 million keystrokes which is more than the traditional 10 million keystrokes in membrane type keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi Peiris M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have been banging on keyboards since 1995 and all of them had one thing or another that was annoying or interfered with the workflow. I am not a gamer. I know folks rave about the awesome lighting and the interchangeable switches and keys, but I'm not about that. This keyboard actually has enough space that the keys aren't all jammed together and the touch is feather light. It is solid as a rock. I don't know what else a person could want in a keyboard no matter what the use is. This far and away the best keyboard ever!
customer_reviews.author: M. Suriani

customer_reviews.title: Great budget mechanical gaming keyboard... With some issues.....
customer_reviews.text: Overall decent build quality for the money, good tactile feedback from the key switches. -Software sucks, it's not as intuitive as logitech or as customizeable as Razr's software but it works. -Space bar orientation is atrocious,like it was printed in the opposite direction. It slopes inward towards the keys instead of down towards the keyboard's bottom frame. Awkward press I had to flip it upside down to just be comfortable enough. I simply can't get over that oversight in the spacebar key design... - Also some switches died after 2 weeks but it's a good thing I have a box of brown/redMX switches laying around....
customer_reviews.author: KSun

customer_reviews.title: Perfect clack-clack
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It's the first "nice" keyboard that I've ever bought myself. I love the satisfying mechanical key clack-clack. There are a bunch of lighting options and it's easy to clean since the buttons aren't recessed into another base. I've had it for about 6-9 months now and I would buy it again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Coming off a main brand mechanical keyboard that started registering double keystrokes more often than not (shortly after warranty of course), this unit works out fine. While some of the features aren't there (separate media keys, programmable macro options) and the lighting isn't incredibly versatile, it is also about 1/3-1/4 the price. Its a heavy little keyboard, so i don't need to worry about that. I definitely recommend getting a wrist cushion for this, or for any keyboard that doesn't include one, especially if you're at the PC for more than 1-2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: N. Wise

customer_reviews.title: OK keyboard - didn't last
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard functioned well, but the RGB LEDs failed after less than 1 month. It wasn't the whole keyboard, but a small region. I would have liked to keep the keyboard because the typing function was fine, but the whole reason I bought it was for the mechanical feel and RBG LED function. I had to return only after 3 weeks. I realize there's always a lemon here and there, but I can't risk the higher price for another faulty one.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great when keys work
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is amazing when the keys work. I don't know if it's just my crap luck but this is my 2nd keyboard that I have gotten from Redragon after the first one had issues right out of the box. Company support was great and they assisted me in fixing the issues. Less than 3 months later several more keys died, replaced and week later same thing. They sent me a 2nd keyboard out and once again right out of the box the R, A and D keys were not working. Replaced and now almost a month later 3 more keys are having issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sasa Stankovic

customer_reviews.title: As my first mechanical keyboard, I am well pleased
customer_reviews.text: Using it I feel like what I am typing is what is being typed. I make less mistakes and definitely feel like my fingers are more engaged due to the keys fully pressing down. I can't explain any of the advantages or what to look for. I just needed a keyboard to use instead of my laptop's. I love the glowing but haven't played with it to change it. Haven't used it for games. And as for ergonomic, I hear mechanical is better versus carpal tunnel but I haven't used it enough to know. Still very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kevan Schanberger

customer_reviews.title: Great Inexpensive Gaming Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Overally, this is amazing build quality for the price. All metal, excellent response and great feel. The biggest issue with the keyboard is the software control honestly - would not recommend this as both a productivity keyboard and gaming keyboard. Media controls are locked to the function keys and there is no function lock, so if you need to use the function keys for something like Excel, you'll need to edit the profiles. Other than that niche instance, this keyboard is solid, well lit, and feels so responsive while gaming or just typing - if you're looking to get into a mechanical keyboard, this is the best way to enter into the wonderful world of mechanical!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hoganson

customer_reviews.title: Problem with the keys.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a programmer, have been since computers had tubes. I like the feel of mechanical keys. I run on linux and don't do gaming. The 'o' key was dead out of the box. I replaced it. Now the 'a' key is intermittent. Some of the keys have a very light touch. I occasionally get extra keystrokes just by putting my fingers on the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ewart

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality "Budget" Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the quality of the keyboard. The keys have a nice feel to them. It makes me wonder what a mechanical keyboard that costs twice as much (if not more) has over this keyboard. I couldn't care less about the LED lights as this is for a work computer, but the options to change the colors is kind of nice. However the lights might be a little bright in a dim room on the highest setting, but might also be a little bit too dim on the brightest setting in a brightly lit room. I am very happy with this keyboard after using it for a couple of weeks. It's a good deal at $60.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Brown

customer_reviews.title: Key Inputs Stick
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good, however it has never worked right despite me trying both the included software and replacing the key switches. My control and shift keys “stick”, not physically but the inputs don’t stop, and they stay that way until I press a different key. The feel is great, but the keys not working makes this extremely hard to use. I don’t know if it’s just my unit, but I’m not happy with how it works. UPDATE After posting this review the seller contacted me and let me know I was still under warranty and offered a full refund/replacement. The QC on the product itself is iffy, but 5 star service from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product mainly for working, I wanted a good keyboard and this surely does it. This is a sturdy, solid, well buit keyboard. Aluminium case is great, no sharp edges, no imperfections just great. I'm very happy with the brown switches, they are not loud at all and works great. Keys caps look perfect and cool they look long-lasting. RGB brightness can be set same as effects. USB cable seems good. Although it's too long for what I need. I totally recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy for fps games
customer_reviews.text: Had to go back to using my keyboard the computer came with because I play wasd games and my palm consistently hits the control key I use to crouch. It needs some kind of modulation so the hand can use wasd comfortably without having to arch the hand to avoid hitting the Ctrl key over and over. Otherwise it's a fantastic keyboard and very responsive. So now it's a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Tanis

customer_reviews.title: Best budget mechanical rgb keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is the best option for those looking for individual rgb lit mechanical keyboard. It can be very clickety if you are looking for that sound and feeling. I bought it after doing some research and later realized I already had the red dragon mouse that fits well with the style. The construction is solid metal and while it can be on the heavy and loud side, this is what I wanted. I would recommend red dragon products based on the rgb mouse and keyboard that I have.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan E. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard, not perfect but great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Positive: Great build quality, cool lighting effects. Negative: the switches are not amazing: they are just fine for the regular sized keys and spacebar, but keys like shift and enter don't really feel like a mechanical keyboard at all - not noticeably more feedback or noise than a membrane keyboard. Also, some of the more advanced/customizable lighting options can be set only through the downloadable software, and (so far as I can tell) are forgotten after you change the settings using the keyboard function buttons. Overall: an amazing keyboard for the price. Easy 5 stars. As a budget keyboard, this is about the best you could hope for (and it is really quite nice).
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Great economically priced mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: If you're in the market for a nice mechanical keyboard, but don't want to spent a mortgage payment, this is the one for you. Keys feel very good, and it's got that mechanical clickiness that you are wanting. Only downside is that sometimes the metal body seems to 'ring', resonating with the key clicks maybe? If you hit a key a little hard, it might reverberate a little, can be a tad annoying, but was not a deal breaker for me. Also, the metal body is very nice, well built. RGB software is easy to use too, so go on and create you light show.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great inexpensive Mechanical keyboard option.
customer_reviews.text: I had been planning on getting a Mechanical keyboard for a while now and had my eye set on one of the more popular brand option. I wasn't in NEED of a new keyboard so I wasn't really rushing because the cost. A friend pointed me to another option which led me to finding the Redragon K556. It had good reviews and after reading up on the switches I was sold on giving it a try especially in it's price range. So far I love it! the Brown Keys are great and so far I haven't had any issues that weren't PEBKAC so if looking for a entry Keyboard I recommend you give this one a try.
customer_reviews.author: Wicket

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is superb quality. The metal frame makes it heavy so it doesn’t slowly scoot away from you throughout the day. Keys are perfectly responsive and give great tactile feedback. The color schemes are fun with many to choose from. No one in my office have complained about noise so it’s quiet enough. Wish it was a bit more ergonomic or that Redragon offered an ergonomic option. I ended up using a wrist pad since my wrists starting hurting after the first week of using it but have been fine since.
customer_reviews.author: Koop

customer_reviews.title: Love the keyboard but keys don't register
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this keyboard. The feel is really nice, it's honestly aesthetically pleasing. However if it doesn't function like a keyboard, then this product truly has no use. It took me 6 retakes on typing this review because when pressed, some of the keys don't register the first time around. I am by no means a "light" typer, and I type very accurately. I have isolated the problem to the keyboard because when i switch back to my other membrane Logitech Keyboard, i have no issues at all..
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Sticky space key -Died after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: It finally died today. When it arrived, it would keep adding spaces after words at random moments... just started running off to the right. But I kept it and coped. BAD DECISION. Today the lights suddenly died. No keyboard. I plugged it into another USB port and it lit up again for about 5 mins and then died. I rebooted, it lit up and died. It is now DONE. It was a BAD purchase decision. Too bad. I really liked the tactile and the feeling of substance.
customer_reviews.author: J.J. DenBurg

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Keyboards.
customer_reviews.text: I gotta tell you, I'm really impressed with Red Dragon keyboards...Incredible value for your buck. I purchased 2 keyboards recently, the K556 for the main computer and the K552 for a second computer I use for reporting crime in the City of Detroit. The build quality is incredible, packaged well on delivery and the back lighting works like a charm. I plan on purchasing more in the future for other computers. I've had zero issues. Coming from regular keyboards to mechanical, I'll never go back. Love typing on these things. Really impressive. Kudos to Red Dragon for making affordable mechanical keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: John Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mechanical keyboard, bought it primarily for gaming but I also use it for all my everyday typing tasks. Very responsive, easier on my hands, and the customizable lighting for the keys is a big plus when different games use different sets of keys. My only issue upon installation was that the left Shift key often stuck. Using the enclosed tool and a can of pressurized air, I popped the keycap off, cleaned, and put it back on. No further issues - hooray! Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Two dead after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a Christmas gift for my son. The U key went out after 3 months. Red-dragon replaced the keyboard outside of the amazon return window. Just last night he was playing Minecraft and the keys started working intermittently and or not working at all. Going to contact Red-Dragon and see if we can get a credit on a different product like a mouse, as we do not want to go though this for a third time on a keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: An Easy  Five Stars, if it had shipped without defect
customer_reviews.text: *Update* Fixed the issue by letting me know what was wrong, and refunded the order. Back to 5*s! I love this keyboard. It's a great value, and has incredible build quality for the price. However, I'm knocking off three stars because it came to me with one of the plastic adjustable feet detached from the bottom of the board. Everything I've read about Redragon is that they have awesome customer support. IF they fix this for me, I'd be excited to move it back to 5*.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Visually Stunning, Love It!
customer_reviews.text: First impressions: Blown away visually out of the box. The weight is also impressive and gives a solid, confident feel. Lighting is brilliant and modes are easily changed, and instructions are on the frist page of the instruction manual. Pretty clever, guys. The mechanical keys (brown) are clicky to the ear, noticable to touch. A comfortable mix. The extra switches are a cool added touch. Cons: There is an echoing "ting" (key clicks echoing through metal case) sound, as mentioned in another review, when typing. It's difficult to notice during gameplay, and unnoticable with headset equipped. I also own a Red Dragon mouse and love both products. I would absolutely buy this keyboard again.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Nycek

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: 3 months into owning this and its an OK keyboard for typing, but horrible with gaming. I have issues with keys not being pressed, and with keys not releasing correctly. While playing a game i will randomly run off while my hand is not on the keyboard since the W key will be depressed, a slight touch of the key and you can hear the switch snap and the running stops. the spacing also seems weird but that could be due to me being used to a larger keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Todd John

customer_reviews.title: Feels great, easy to customize colors, works well MOST of the time
customer_reviews.text: Two keys have started working intermittently, making it very very annoying to use: the UP arrow and the M key. At first I though there was a software glitch from an OS update, but the missed keypresses have gotten continually worse. I'm switching out the switches with the spares they thankfully included in the box, but hope I don't have to do this again anytime soon. I didn't expect to be replacing switches after only a couple months!
customer_reviews.author: T. Mackey

customer_reviews.title: Key lettering is odd.
customer_reviews.text: I like that I have a keyboard with a single solid backlit color and I can control the brightness. What is odd is that many of the numbers are no etched completely. The 0 looks like parentheses. Same with the letter O. Other letters and number also have breaks in them. The other odd thing is that the keys with different characters for use with the shift key do not have them printed vertically one character above the other on the key, which is pretty much universal on typewriters and other keyboards. It will take time to get used to that.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W.

customer_reviews.title: Keys stopped working very quickly, had to swap out switches multiple times.
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing games for like 12 years now and this keyboard was honestly my least favorite out of any ive used, it feels nice to press the buttons but after like 3 months the switches in the keys started slowly being unresponsive, I.E Holding w would be sparratic for a few seconds then go back to normal, at once point i actually had a key pop out of the socket while i was typing. I had to swap switches to just about everyone extra one they send you with in like 6 months, dont waste your time, it looks pretty and works great, for all of 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: I quite like this keyboard, it's my third mechanical keyboard. Pros: Sturdy build The parts are user serviceable, in that I was able to completely dissemble it and reassemble it, replace switches etc. Comes with extra switches Nice set of preset lights Cons: The key puller it comes with is really low quality and useless after several pulling The num lock, scroll lock and caps lock indicator lights are screamingly bright red which is very distracting (I fixed this by taping it over with a translucent tape) Does not provide a way to change the color of individual key light
customer_reviews.author: Sam A.

customer_reviews.title: Still the best keyboard I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: My Logitech K800, a great keyboard died, twice. My G.SKILL RIPJAWS died. Every other mechanical keyboard has died on me, it's terrible. I can't believe I spent over double on my old Corsair keyboard that died in 6 months and didn't even have the same tactile experience this one does. This keyboard is awesome, full stop. I dumped a drink on this on a Friday gaming night, immediately unplugged it and let it sit on a towel upside down for about a week. Plugged it back in, it struggeled, but eventually came back and I'm typing on it right now with no issues. Really great mechanical keyboard, I still love the feel of it, it's friggin' perfect.
customer_reviews.author: JerryBee

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest, the reason I purchased this keyboard was not for gaming at all. Though, if I come around to getting myself a gaming computer, I will definitely use it. However, I bought it just to make work slightly more intersting and I must say, it does just that. A bit noisy as I anticipated but with everyone out the office besides me, it does not matter. Love it. No complaints. Also very sturdy which I absolutely love.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Griffin

customer_reviews.title: doestn't feel like a mechanical keyboard the keys are not very responsive
customer_reviews.text: The K552-BB-2 now that is a mechanical keyboard. I'm use to the K552 it has all the sounds and the key are comfortable. I really don't understand how a cheaper keyboard sounds better and respond better than a more expensive one. I need it a keyboard with a numerical keypad so I chose this one. Wrong choice. I have always bought Redragon mice and keyboards and this is the first time that I have been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Makora

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic keyboard that won't break the wallet.
customer_reviews.text: I gotta admit I was a bit skeptical when it came to buying this keyboard. I was going to drop over a hundred bucks on something more expensive but I'm glad I didn't! The keys feel fantastic, the build quality feels solid. My only complaint really is the lack of a hand wrest, but a 3rd party gel pad for keyboards does the job just fine. It also comes with extra key switches which is a plus. The only downside is they are multiple colors, and I would have preferred if they were all brown like the keyboard is (only 2 extra browns included). But those are just bonus anyway, overall I am very happy with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is my 3rd redragon keyboard
customer_reviews.text: And I'll keep buying them! First I had a full-sized red-only one. I loved it for the price so I got a tenkey-less one, also loved it. Wanted one that had different colors and got this one. I don't use their software, so if I want to change color it's just a keystroke away, but I prefer it that way. Switches are snappy and responsive. Noise level is somewhere in the middle as far as mechanical keyboards go. For the price you'll be hard pressed to find better, especially for a fully rgb keyboard with a metal case!
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic typing experience
customer_reviews.text: I type all day and this keyboard is fantastic. Outemu brown switches give me just (barely) enough tactile feedback for typing without the loud clicking of blue switches. A tiny bit more would be great but that's not a complaint, really. It's still got a bit of noise from the bottoming out of the keys (you can get o-rings to dampen that) and a bit on the reset also. Not obnoxiously so, but far from silent. It's heavy too. It's got a really solid heft.
customer_reviews.author: ayemossum

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard and great Amazon Support!
customer_reviews.text: My keyboard came in yesterday and it was Dead On Arrival, so why the 5 star rating? Because I contacted amazon tech support via my account and when we couldn't get it to work, the tech overnighted me a replacement and took care of processing my return. The new keyboard works beautifully. I love the feel of the mechanical keys and all the color options. Best keyboard I've ever owned. I am not a gamer, so it will be used primarily for work. Also love that it has an 18 month warranty. Buy it, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this keyboard, lot of custom setting and colors. The only thing I noticed is when I first got the keyboard for like a day or so every time I would type or tap on the base of the keyboard there would be a really loud ping sound, it was almost so bad I thought I was going to have to send it back. It no longer makes that ping sound but I'm not sure what happened... I do wish it came with a wrist lifter(?)
customer_reviews.author: R. Benoit

customer_reviews.title: Best Budget Keyboard out there!
customer_reviews.text: I was thoroughly surprised by this budget keyboard, in a good way. The first thing you need to know is that this keyboard is metal which I didn't know when buying it. It gives it an amazing smooth/cold feel. And there are so many options for RGB! I also love that they give you different switches to try out, they give you two black, two brown, two red, and two blue in a neat little foam holder. Honestly, everything is great about this keyboard. My only complaint is that they didn't include a separate set of keys for volume control, you have to use FN+F2/F3/F4. But other than that you're getting an amazing real mechanical gaming keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Plante

customer_reviews.title: Great budget keyboard
customer_reviews.text: For a mechanical RGB keyboard is like to think you can beat the price. Sure you can spend 2,3,4 times as much and get really fancy keyboards, but this one works. I got the cherry MX browns which I like. The keyboard works well for gaming and for when I’m working. My only complaint is that it doesn’t come with a wrist rest.
customer_reviews.author: Parkercxx12

customer_reviews.title: It has the right feel but the keycaps about 2/3s ...
customer_reviews.text: It has the right feel but the keycaps about 2/3s the normal width. This throws off my touch typing a fair bit. Doesn't work well with the Mac. Edit: LTC reached out to me when they read the review and very generously offered to make the situation right for me. Their customer service is very good and adds value to this keyboard. This is critical because enough time had passed that I didn't think to bring it up nor did I have the original packing anymore for a return. LTC did not care about that but wanted me, the customer, to be happy with their product. Other companies would do well to take this lesson to heart.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: It's a fun keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I did not purchase this for gaming...I loved the colons on the keyboard...my grandson got me hooked on it. And when I had a minor issue your rep Eline was most helpful. Made it so easy for me. Since I am a senior citizen I am hoping this will last me quite a while...but you can be sure that if anything happens, Eline will be the first person I contact for assistance. She made it a pleasurable experience.
customer_reviews.author: Asiia Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a few months then broke
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard was absolutely perfect for a few months but then the A and D keys started having issues (where they would not recognize a key press once in a while). The keyboard came with additional switches so I attempted to replace the A switch and then the key stopped working completely. I would not recommend this keyboard as a keyboard should last more than just a few months. I will say I use it all day every day as I'm a software developer so I may do more typing than the average user but it certainly should last longer than it did.
customer_reviews.author: GeekSage

customer_reviews.title: this is a beast keyboard for a good price
customer_reviews.text: i will simply say it is a heavy duty, easy to use, plug and play gaming mechanical keyboard. i have been using it for 6 months now and have turned several people on to it. it is very weighty and never moves on my desk unless i move it. my only complaint so far has been that the space bar sometimes is over responsive, but that is more due to where i hit it when typing. great buy.
customer_reviews.author: jesse t. houdlette

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is my firts mechanical keyword and I must admit I wasn't sure about buying it because I thought it would be too noisy to work at home but I was quite surprised at how quiet it is. The only detail I had was a key that came more sunk than the others, but with the spare part it has and the tools, I changed it and the problem was solved. Excellent keyboard, very comfortable for typing and smooth, plus the soft clicking sound when pressing the keys. I really loved it. It also has a lot of light effects that are pretty cool. 100% recommended
customer_reviews.author: Jhon C.

customer_reviews.title: Better than Cherry MX Brown Keyboards
customer_reviews.text: This is redragons's version of the cherry mx brown. I think their version feels and sounds better than the MX. This keyboard has a nice texture and click to it (brown=quieter but still has click sound). You can change each individual keys's color and do different color settings (like rainbows or rain effects) through their easy to use software. Previously, I had issues with other keyboards because the the colors would leak out (red specifically), this keyboard contains all the keys and each color you choose from the color wheel is exclusive and doesn't have other weird colors trying to mix with it stand out (had that happen before). Stop searching and get this keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Krag Jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 1 day
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 1-day then the space bar quit working, then the lights went out and nothing. Rebooted system and tried several different USB ports with no luck. Got my old keyboard plugged into same USB port with no problems. Very poor quality control. This is so disappointing b/c I liked the build quality and keys of this KB, but the electronics need to be more robust than this.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: The spacebar only works sometimes, like when you smash it down.
customer_reviews.text: Every time I type anything, unless I am literally smashing the spacebar button down, I have to go back and fill in the spaces between words. Typing anything has become a huge chore. Jumping in Overwatch has also become a hit or miss. This keyboard looks nice in the picture, but the lighting software is pretty limited in its functionality. Nothing as cool as the old corsair keyboard I had. Maybe the keyboard I got is just a lemon, but I wouldn't recommend this. Spend the extra money and get something that you won't want to trash a couple ofmonths later.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Postitive Revision to my review, Originally "No luck with Mech keyboards no matter what I spend."
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I wrote this: "I am having horrible problems with every mech keyboard I buy. Magicelec barely worked a week, and this one died after the return window but only a few days after that. The LED lights are now frozen and the asterisk key on the numpad repeats consistently. I give up. Membrane keyboards for me from now on." I had given it two stars. But then, I was contacted by the store who sold it, by email! They offered a replacement keyboard, free! This store is stellar. They go through the reviews and proactively contact you, and they make things right! These are great people! Thank you!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Mayo

customer_reviews.title: Great mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard in my home office. I don't use it for gaming, but for general work purposes. Great sturdy design. I can definitely feel the difference of the reduced resistance of a mechanical keyboard and am able to type faster on it. Less loud than some other mechanical keyboards I have owned. I always feel these color changing things are a bit of a gimic rather than having a normal backlight but you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: eb

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard! WOW
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard build quality is phenomenal! No plastic whatsoever, it feels very sturdy, however; it's a bit too heavy, but I personally don't mind that, I actually like that! The rgb is great, you have tons of effects to choose from, however; the white color is a bit pink, and I wish the rgb was brighter overall. The keys feel amazing once you get used to them. Comfort is good. The keys are a bit loud, but not too crazy, I actually like the sound they make. For the price, I would totally recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Javier Roche

customer_reviews.title: Great for a base as a custom keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I modified this keyboard by changing all the switches to box jade. The switches did not fit, as one of the pins was too big, so I had to dremel down the switches, but after they fit. Added on some pudding keycaps and the keyboard works fantastic. Before that the keyboard was good, just not a fan of tactile switches, would recommended red or blue switches.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Padilla

customer_reviews.title: It's very small
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be solidly constructed as the base is very heavy - much heavier than other boards that I've owned. On the other hand, the overall size is much smaller than any other keyboard I've owned. Worked as soon as I plugged it in. Has sort of a pulsing rainbow effect - pretty. The keys click satisfyingly, but the caps are very plasticky. No wrist rest, but you do get a mechanical keyboard with RGB and a num pad for 55 bucks. Personally, I'd pay another 20 for a more spacious layout, a wrist rest, and maybe some media controls; but I'm not complaining.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard for the money, customer service is very helpful.
customer_reviews.text: This is very heavy duty and will built, but the one I received is slightly twisted and doesn't sit flat on my desk. Too bad it will be going back. Update: Customer service sent me a new one, this one is very good. I really like the feel of the keyboard, if your debating on the blue or brown keys, I'd go for the brown, the brown are a bit quieter and. But if you like the blue keys, get the K580, it isn't as heavy duty as this one, but the backlight is more vibrant and and it has media buttons.
customer_reviews.author: James D Lotz

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard + customer service
customer_reviews.text: The first keyboard I received had one key not working (nothing happens when pressing that key). While I think their quality control can be better, the customer service was top notch. They sent me another keyboard promptly and asked me to dispose the first defective keyboard. The second keyboard works great; overall, it's a pleasant experience.
customer_reviews.author: S. Song

customer_reviews.title: Overall spectacular!
customer_reviews.text: To begin, I've had a few rough run ins with keyboards (not from misuse, just pour quality). I have spent more and recieved less from other manufacturers and this one is by far the best keyboard I have found. It's simple, I love the colors and color changing, the base of the key board is the sturdiest I have found so far. I do wish that there was a rest for your wrist, however, it is a very basic keyboard. At first, before receiving the product, I had low expectations, thinking "oh this is gonna be another cheap keyboard", but after it arrived and had it unboxed, I was blown away. I highly recommend this for anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: First, this thing is a tank. Pretty sure you could use it to defend yourself in an home invasion and win. This thing weighs a hefty sum. The clicks are crisp and quick. Colors and patterns available built in are varied and fun to explore as well as bright and vibrant. Sadly I could not get the supposed software to work but no biggie. Keys can be a little touchy and lead to typos if you are not square up on it and sitting proper. Probably just me though. Overall quite happy with it and can't wait to get a mouse paired up with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristofer Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great product, greater customer support
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction. It's heavy and works great. Love the sound of the brown switch. Have been using this for more than 18 months. Faced a small issue on pressing a specific combination of keys while gaming. I reached out to the customer support and they provided a few personalized software updates. When nothing worked, they promptly sent me a brand new replacement keyboard. Amazing customer service. Already have the k552 and k556, will definitely buy again from Redragon.
customer_reviews.author: Subbrammanian Nochur Ganeswaran

customer_reviews.title: Quality Keyboard, Discount Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a study, heavy keyboard with cherry style switches (maybe blue?) that doesn't double enter keys the way many others do. The keys are light and reasonable quiet compared to cherry reds. It lacks a dedicated volume control. Volume and other controls are implemented using a function key to the right of the space bar. The led lighting isn't obnoxious and while not programmable has a nice menu of presets to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Ron in Tucson

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard, Great Lights, Smooth Keys
customer_reviews.text: I am not a gamer but wanted to up my typing game and this keyboard does the trick. My fingers easily glide across these keys and I type a lot faster and more accurately on this keyboard compared to other keyboards I've used (which have all been the standard Microsoft membrane type that you'd find in office supply or big box stores. I really like the default color pattern so I haven't changed it nor have I fiddled with any of the actual keys. It has a nice heft to it and the box is sturdy and compact enough that I saved it in case I need to travel with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy  ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

customer_reviews.title: Perfect combination for gaming or typing
customer_reviews.text: First mechanical keyboard and I'm already impressed. The keyboard has the Cherry MX Brown equivalent keys and they are snappy, feel good to the fingers, and while there is audible clicking when typing, it's not annoying. The LED lighting is easily adjustable and it comes with tools needed to replace any key. They keyboard feels solid, has a good weight to it and it doesn't slide around on the desk. The only thing missing is a good wrist rest, which can always be purchased later. Overall very happy with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: drambo

customer_reviews.title: Good- but switches are too hard to replace
customer_reviews.text: One of the biggest reasons I wanted to try a mechanical key board was the ability to swap out switches. This key board came twith 2 spares of each kind. However when I went to swap them out I can not pull out the original switches. the top clear plastic crushes before I can get the key out. I was able to the '-' on the number pad out by removing the side panel and nudging it a bit with a screw driver. I alos remove an arrow key... but it got pretty mangled.
customer_reviews.author: David & Keshia Allred

customer_reviews.title: I like this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard because I like the tactile feel of a mechanical keyboard. I am not a gamer. For general computer use the keyboard is excellent. It's a bit loud but I don't find it irritating. The illumination makes it easy to type with the lights off in the room. That's a feature I much appreciate. The software is easy to use and it's fun to change the light scheme. I have a Redragon mouse as well and it's also excellent. All-in-all I would recommend this keyboard. It's an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Photo Man

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Great for the price. Contains internal memory so it will keep any custom profile you set if you uninstall the software or move the keyboard to another PC. The key switches (mechanical browns) are great. A little on the "clacky" side, but that's normal for browns. Only minor complaint is that their "white" color is not very good. Looks a little washed out. Kinda creamy. Recommend the color code R:160 G:215 B:255 to get a better white.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I had been in the market for a mechanical keyboard but I thought the $150 price tag for some of these other keyboards was crazy. After doing a bunch of research I chose the Redragon K556. This has been a great keyboard. The feedback is excellent, and the size is great. I have a different mechanical keyboard at work and I'm going to be replacing it with this one. The lighting options are great on this keyboard. I would highly recommend this keyboard to anyone looking to get into a mechanical keyboard at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Novotny

customer_reviews.title: Just alright
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was just alright for me. I never liked the hard feel of the keystrokes and loud clacking, I got more used to it but never really liked it. The space bar failed after 10 months and the letter "s" became unreliable, so I let it go. I actually liked the number and diversity of key color/pattern options.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I received a faulty keyboard but the headache was very short-lived. I emailed customer service and received a prompt email back from Eline (what an angel!) and they let me know that they'd be sending me a replacement and to keep the faulty board! I received it quickly and it's working perfectly! I would definitely recommend this seller and the products they sell, the keyboard is perfect and is absolutely satisfying to type on. Thanks again for all your help, Eline!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Napier

customer_reviews.title: First Mechanical Keyboard - It's Great
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mechanical keyboard. I also wanted to be able to customize individual key backlight color to group keys for a software app I use, so I chose this one. I haven't set up the individual colors yet, but the keyboard feel is great. It's got a nice click, but not so loud as the blue switches and not the squishy indefinite feel like the reds. While the overall build of this keyboard feels really solid, the big question in my mind is how well it will hold up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Zippy

customer_reviews.title: nice mechanical keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I think it's cool. I like it, it types well, though I'm still (re)adjusting to mechanical. It "feels" a tiny bit more cramped than my 17" laptop keyboard, but I think it's the key height difference vs my laptop keyboards The brown switches are responsive but not too clicky, and I like that it came with other switches, blue, black, brown (& red ?). Lights are perfect - bright but not crazy. I'm not a gamer, got it for typing and coding, and wonder if back legs to angle it would make it more comfortable. Wrist rest may help and raising my chair so my arms are at the right height.
customer_reviews.author: mat nardone

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful keyboard that I can't help but stare at a lot. I've been complimented by others how nice it is. It's got some weight to it, and the keys feel great. The LEDs are bright, and have plenty of color in each key with plenty of features. My only gripe is that I'm used to keyboards with wrist rests, but it's something I'm quickly getting used.
customer_reviews.author: Thefireball

customer_reviews.title: Great for Typing
customer_reviews.text: Improved my WPM and reduced mistakes due to its tactile feedback. Keyboard is solid and doesn't move around on me as I type fast. The LED features are more than I need, but it certainly looks cool and has a lot of options. Best keyboard I've ever owned. The only thing I'm curious about is whether a cherry mx brown branded switch would be even better. However, at about half the price as keyboards with cherry mx switches, I doubt any negligible difference would be worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for Buck Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Had Cherry MX Blue's and Red's, Logitech's "Romer G" and now this. Feels almost similar to Cherry, very, very close to it, just half the cost. Romer G is not great, key caps break easily. Red Dragon's key's are modular and can be swapped with Red, Blue, Black, etc.. to suit your needs. Highly recommended. P.S. The name attracted me because my car was called "Red Dragon" in Turbo Magazine of 2005 :).
customer_reviews.author: SPLWF

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Keyboard for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an entry level mechanical keyboard that didn't break the bank but still gave me that feel that I was looking for. This keyboard doesn't disappoint. I've been using this keyboard for over a month now and I'm very satisfied with the purchase. It feels great to type on, the brown switches give me that tactile feel without the noise that a blue switch brings. Best of both worlds, in my opinion. I would highly recommend this keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Marick

customer_reviews.title: A solid beast that begs for more.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third redragon keyboard for me, 2 for relatives. Well built, solid, doesn't move, cupped keys are a pleasure to use, didn't think I'd care about the lighting show, but now I do, you know how old men are. Over turned a glass of milk on top of the keyboard and the thing didn't even blink. Just wiped it off with a cloth and shook it out, cleaned the corners with q tips. That was a month ago and the keyboard is great, no smell, nothing changed. Remarkable. Been using keyboards since they were made, seriously. Hands down, best keyboard ever for me. Oh, and I'm a key banger, and a destroyer of keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Curt O

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard daily, for work. The switches offer excellent tactile feedback. The ability to annoy co-workers with the sound of my typing is a welcome bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: After barely 3 months, 4 keys do not work anymore.
customer_reviews.text: The switches started failing after a month, but I used the extra switches provided. After 3 months, now the keys do not work. I tried changing the switches but those 4 keys do not work and have not light at all so they are damaged. I used normally the keyboard but it just failed. I have had other keyboards that lasted years. I would not buy this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfying and responsive
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mechanical keyboard and I love it so far. The lights are very clear and bright and look really high quality. The schemes available through the software also all look great. I wasn't sure abt the brown keys but I really like them--there is some audible clicks but dang it feels and sounds good. I've had to adjust some of my gaming mic settings but overall I am very happy with this purchase and would recommend it without any reservations. The metal finish is also very satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Mellon

customer_reviews.title: PICK SOMETHING ELSE!!! Didn't even make it 90 days!
customer_reviews.text: There was an odd spring/vibration sound under the left hand home row keys... Now, there is sporatic but frequent non-response under those same keys. Amazon only allows returns for 30 days after purchase. Since I have had the keyboard for a whopping 74 days, returning is not an option. No luck so far regarding warranty support with Redragon, but I will update if that changes.
customer_reviews.author: SueNC

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, but awful keycaps
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is great. It's heavy, well-made, and uses replaceable switches (albeit using a proprietary switch, not a standard switch). It comes with replacement switches (although instead of 8 Brown switches, they give you two of each (Red, Brown, Blue, Black). The keycaps are not good though. They have glossy sides, the font is uneven and ugly, the Windows key says "Win" instead of the Windows icon, the keycaps have sharp and uncomfortable edges (mostly noticeable on the spacebar), and multiple keycaps showed wear (scratches and nicks) from out of the box. If you are considering this keyboard, I would strongly recommend preparing to buy a set of replacement keycaps.
customer_reviews.author: dm42

customer_reviews.title: Liking Redragon brand more and more
customer_reviews.text: So far so good I got the k556 rgb with the browns I had to k552 rgb but wanted ti try browns blues are so loud. Not as much a tactile bum as I expected but much more quite. I am no expert in keyboards or anything but I just do see brands like corsair to be that much better to make up the price gap here I had my last one a year and it still fine right now no dead switches. U just got this cus less noise and the keypad. Its waterproof metal base what you what it to to serve you drinks? No brainer, if you just need a good rgb mech keyboard Redragon all day.
customer_reviews.author: Gorganzolia

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard as a budget replacement for my razer blackwidow. When I got it, it felt sturdy. But I found the keystrokes to be a little heavy and it wasn't as clicky as my razer was. I brushed it off as me not being used to it so I continued using it. It never got any easier. I felt clumsy using it, and within a couple months of having it, the space bar began to not register if I pressed it from anywhere other than the center.
customer_reviews.author: Callie

customer_reviews.title: Good feel, not loud but just enough feedback.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, the color setting isn't software based, but it is very cool once you get the feel for it. I actually prefer the mechanical method since that's one less piece of software I have to run! Once you have it setup you are good to go.. you can dim from the keyboard no need to access any software!
customer_reviews.author: gerard l lewis jr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who loves gaming and is a computer scientist--he loves it! I also love using it. The mechanical keyboard types a lot better than a membrane keyboard. Love the colors, feel, and sound.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Orozco

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. Feels great and its made of Aluminum. My only complaint is that the keys are SUPER sensitive, which had I done some research on key types for mechanical keyboards I would have known this, so it is by no fault of the manufacturer or seller. What it has taught me is not to keep my finger on the F key in a vehicle playing PUBG. Because if a dust particle touches your finger while it is resting there, you will dive out of the vehicle killing yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Richard O.

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife because she does a not-insignificant-amount of typing. She loves the colors and it helps with her wrist problems. Both the wife and I use mechanical because there's just an inherent strain factor in membrane keyboards, and we've both had wrist problems in the past. I personally like this one because it's easy on the fingers too, it doesn't require a lot of typing force.
customer_reviews.author: Terabitman

product_meta.title: Redragon K556 RGB LED Backlit Wired Mechanical Gaming Keyboard, Aluminum Base, 104 Standard Keys
feature_bullets: MECHANICAL BROWN SWITCHES: Offering the best tactile typing experience, also being ever so slightly quieter, fitting for office or gaming use. And you will get 8 spared switches as a gift.

18 BACKLIT MODES: Press FN+INS-PgDn to enter Pro-gamer mode. RGB LED adjustable lighting with 6-themed backlights -18 lighting models. You can also adjust their brightness with FN+“↑”and“↓” Besides, there is a 9-color single backlit mode for this keyboard.

N-KEY ROLLOVER. ERGONOMIC AND DURABLE DESIGN: This keyboard is made of full metal material, with matte-finish texture, solid enough to protect it from scratch. It allows multi-keys to work simultaneously with high speed.
KEYCAPS DESIGN: The Redragon K556 features a custom designed keycap that has been made shorter to reduce the time it takes for your actions to register.
FLEXIBLE REMOVABLE KEYCAPS AND WIDE COMPATIBILITY: With Key Cap Puller. Support computer system including Windows10, Windows 8, Windows 7, Mac OS X, Windows XP, Windows VISTA, etc.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,304 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
